mdRecord.dcterms:title: King and Queen of the Belgians in the Upper Garden, October 29, 1919
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: National Pictorial News
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Elisabeth, Queen, consort of Albert I, King of the Belgians, 1876-1965
Albert I, King of the Belgians, 1875-1934
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photographic print of the royal party in the upper garden. In the foreground, from left to right are: Mount Vernon Resident Superintendent Harrison H. Dodge; Queen Elisabeth, consort of Albert I; Vice President Thomas R. Marshall (back to camera); Albert I; and Miss Townsend, Vice Regent for New York. The photographer's stamp appears on the reverse. A handwritten caption (by Harrison Dodge) reads: 'Queen Elisabeth has asked the Supt. what that fine bush is (box [boxwood]) and might she have a sprig of it for a souvenir! The King, V. P. Marshall, and Miss Amy Townsend, witnesses.'
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Upper Garden
